    Quick Start Guide

Plots a Kaplan-Meier Survival Curve using ggsurvplot with Custom Defaults

Source: R/plot_KM.R
plot_KM.Rd

This function generates a Kaplan-Meier survival curve plot using the ggsurvplot function. It allows for customization of various plot elements while providing sensible defaults that align with the easysurv theme.

Usage

plot_KM(
  fit,
  title = NULL,
  subtitle = NULL,
  legend.labs = NULL,
  legend.title = ggplot2::element_blank(),
  legend.position = "top",
  conf.int = TRUE,
  conf.int.alpha = 0.3,
  conf.int.style = "ribbon",
  tables.col = "black",
  risk.table = TRUE,
  risk.table.pos = "out",
  risk.table.fontsize = 4,
  risk.table.title = "Number at risk",
  cumevents = FALSE,
  cumcensor = FALSE,
  surv.median.line = "hv",
  axes.offset = FALSE,
  font.family = "Roboto Condensed",
  plot.theme = theme_easysurv(),
  risk.table.theme = theme_easysurv(grid = FALSE),
  use_plotly = FALSE,
  fun = NULL,
  surv.scale = "percent",
  xlim = c(0, max(fit$time)),
  ...
)

Arguments

fit

A survfit object or list of survfit objects.

title

Optional. A title for the KM plot. Default is NULL

subtitle

Optional. A subtitle for the KM plot. Default is NULL

legend.labs

character vector specifying legend labels. Used to replace the names of the strata from the fit. Should be given in the same order as those strata.

legend.title

The title of the legend.

legend.position

The position of the legend in the plot. Allowed values are "left", "right", "bottom", "top", or "none".

conf.int

Logical value indicating whether to display the confidence interval.

conf.int.alpha

The transparency level of the confidence interval fill color. Value should be in the range of <0, 1>, where 0 is fully transparent and 1 is fully opaque.

conf.int.style

The style of the confidence interval. Allowed values are "ribbon" or "step".

tables.col

Colour to be used for all tables under the main plot. Default is "black". Can be "strata".

risk.table

Logical value indicating whether to show the "number at risk" table.

risk.table.pos

The position of the risk table relative to the main plot. Allowed values are "out" (outside) or "in" (inside).

risk.table.fontsize

The font size for the risk table.

risk.table.title

The title for the risk table.

cumevents

Logical to include cumulative events table. Default is FALSE

cumcensor

Logical to include cumulative censoring table. Default is FALSE

surv.median.line

Specifies whether and how to draw a horizontal or vertical line at the median survival time. Allowed values are "none", "hv" (both horizontal and vertical), "h" (horizontal), or "v" (vertical).

axes.offset

Logical value indicating whether to set the plot axes to start at the origin. Default is FALSE. When FALSE, recommend that xlim is set to something like c(0, max(fit$time)) to not cut off the end.

font.family

The font for the chart and risk table. Default is "Roboto Condensed".

plot.theme

function, ggplot2 theme name. Default value is theme_easysurv(). Allowed values include ggplot2 official themes: see theme.

risk.table.theme

function, ggplot2 theme name. Default value is theme_easysurv(grid = FALSE). Allowed values include ggplot2 official themes:see theme.

use_plotly

Optional. Whether to return a plotly output for the KM plot. Default is FALSE.

fun

Survival function. Can take on "survival", "event", "cumhaz", "cloglog"

surv.scale

Scale transformation of survival curves. ggsurvplot allows "default" or "percent". When FUN is not specified, the easysurv default is "percent".

xlim

Two numeric values, specifying the left/lower limit and the right/upper limit of the scale.

...

Additional arguments to be passed to the ggsurvplot function.

Value

A list containing the plot object and the risk table object.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
library(survival)
fit <- survfit(Surv(time, status) ~ as.factor(sex), data = lung)
plot_KM(fit,
legend.title = "Sex", legend.position = "bottom", conf.int = TRUE)
}
